theme:
# Themes

Theme section to customize the layout and colors of the context menu.

## Syntax

```text
theme
{
    name = value
    view = value
    dark = value
    background { ... }
    item { ... }
    border { ... }
    shadow { ... }
    font { ... }
    separator { ... }
    symbol { ... }
    image { ... }
    layout { ... }
}
```

## Description

The `theme` section allows you to customize the visual appearance of context menus, including colors, fonts, spacing, effects, and layout options.

## Main Properties

* **name** - Theme name: `auto`, `classic`, `white`, `black`, or `modern`
* **view** - View size: `auto`, `compact`, `small`, `medium`, `large`, `wide`
* **dark** - Dark mode: `true`, `false`, or `default`

## Sub-sections

### background

Customize the menu background:

```text
background
{
    color = color value
    opacity = value from 0 to 100
    effect = auto // 0 = disable, 1 = transparent, 2 = blur, 3 = acrylic
    effect = [3, tint color, opacity] // for acrylic
    gradient { ... }
}
```

### item

Customize menu item appearance:

```text
item
{
    opacity = value from 0 to 100
    radius = value from 0 to 3
    prefix = 1 // auto, 0 = dont display, 1 = display, 2 = ignore
    text { normal = color, select = color, ... }
    back { normal = color, select = color, ... }
    border { normal = color, select = color, ... }
    padding { left = value, top = value, right = value, bottom = value }
    margin { left = value, top = value, right = value, bottom = value }
}
```

### border

Customize menu border:

```text
border
{
    enabled = boolean value
    size = value from 0 to 10
    color = value
    opacity = value
    radius = value
    padding { ... }
}
```

### shadow

Customize menu shadow:

```text
shadow
{
    enabled = boolean value
    size = value from 0 to 30
    color = value
    opacity = value from 0 to 100
    offset = value from 0 to 30
}
```

### font

Customize menu font:

```text
font
{
    size = value start from 6
    name = "tahoma"
    weight = value from 1 to 9
    italic = 0
}
```

### separator

Customize separator appearance:

```text
separator
{
    size = value from 0 to 40
    color = value
    opacity = value
    margin { ... }
}
```

### symbol

Customize symbols (chevron, checkmark, bullet):

```text
symbol
{
    normal = color
    normal.disabled = color
    select = color
    select.disabled = color
    // or
    chevron { ... }
    checkmark { ... }
    bullet { ... }
}
```

### image

Customize image display:

```text
image
{
    enabled = boolean value
    color = [color1, color2, color3]
    gap = value
    glyph = "font name"
    scale = boolean value
    align = value // 0 = check mark only, 1 = image only, 2 = both
}
```

### layout

Customize layout:

```text
layout
{
    rtl = boolean value // Right-to-left for Middle Eastern languages
    popup = value from -20 to 20 // Align submenus
}
```

## Padding and Margin Syntax

Use shorthand with four values:

```text
padding = [1, 2, 3, 4] // left=1, right=2, top=3, bottom=4
```

Use shorthand with two values:

```text
padding = [4, 2] // left=4, right=4, top=2, bottom=2
```

Use shorthand with one value:

```text
padding = 4 // all sides = 4
```
import:
# Import tag

To better organise the configuration file, parts of the configuration can be saved in separate files. These are then imported using the import tag. With this method, it is also possible to import the same file as a sort of "module" into different parts of the configuration. A convenient way to include the same sub-menu in different locations.

## Syntax
The general syntax is as follows:

```text
import %path%
```

Where:
- `%section%` is the name of a section. Optional. If given, it must be one of `settings`, `themes`, `modify-items`, `new-items`. The section name is written literally, without quotes.
- `%path%` is a string literal, that returns the path to the config file that shall be imported. This can be a relative path or an absolute path. Expressions are supported when using single quotes.

### Import an entire section
```text
import %path%
```
Content of the file at `%path%` will be imported into a newly created `section{}`.

### Import as a partial
```text
section {
    import %path%
}
```
Content of the file at `%path%` will be imported into the existing `section{}`.
menu:
# Menu

Represents a context menu that can contain multiple entries, including items, sub-menus, separators, or imports.

## Syntax

```text
menu(title = value [property = value [...] ])
{
    [ item() [...] ]
    [ menu(){} [...] ]
    [ separator [...] ]
    [ import 'path/to/import.nss' [...] ]
}
```

## Description

* **New Items:** Add new entries to the context menu.
* **Sub-items:** Menus can include optional sub-entries, which may consist of:

  * **Item entries** — single top-level menu entries.
  * **Menu entries** — sub-menus containing their own sub-items.
  * **Separator entries** — horizontal lines separating entries.
  * **Imports** — external content inserted at the import position.

## Example

```text
item(title = 'Hello, World!')
separator
menu(title = 'sub menu' image = #0000ff)
{
    item(title = 'test sub-item')
}
```

## Notes

* Either `title` or `image` property is mandatory for menu entries.
* The term **menuitem** encompasses `item`, `menu`, and `separator`.

# Item

Items create a single menu entry.

# Properties
Either a title or a image property is mandatory (set to a non-null value).

For further details, please refer to the [properties page](https://nilesoft.org/docs/configuration/properties).

## Syntax
```text
item( title = value [property = value [...] ])```
remove:
# Remove

Removes existing context menu items from the system or third-party menus.

## Syntax

```text
remove(find = value)
```

## Description

The `remove` entry is used to delete existing menuitems from context menus. It identifies targets by matching their title property against the `find` property value.

## Properties

* **find** (mandatory) - Pattern used to identify targets by matching against their title property.

## Example

```text
modify-items
{
    remove(find = 'copy')
    remove(find = 'paste')
    remove(find = '"format"')
}
```

## Notes

* The `find` property is mandatory and must match the title of the item to be removed.
* String literals in the `find` property should be enclosed in quotes when they contain special characters.
modify:
# Modify Items

The optional modify section contains entries to modify existing context menu items, added by the system or by a third party.

## Syntax

```text
modify(find = value [property = value [...] ])
```

## Description

Modify items contain instructions on how to identify existing menuitems (also referred to as Target), and when and what changes should be applied to them.

This is done by matching an existing menuitem's title property against the modify item's mandatory `find` property. If a match is found, the other properties of the modify item are applied to the appropriate menuitem, such as changing their properties (e.g. title, icon, visibility), or moving them to another location.

## Properties

Item entries can define three different sets of properties:

### Validation Properties

Determine if a given item entry should be processed when a context menu is displayed. Optional.

### Filter Properties

Determine if a given menuitem is a valid target for the process instructions:

* **find** (mandatory) - Pattern used to identify targets by matching against their title property.
* **in** - Used to identify targets by specifying the submenu in which they are located.

### Process Instructions

Define what to do with the target. Optional. However, if there are no process instruction specified, the entry is of no practical use. These consist of properties from the two property classes: menuitem properties and command properties.

For a complete overview and further details regarding applicable properties, please refer to the [properties page](https://nilesoft.org/docs/configuration/properties).

## Example

```text
modify-items
{
    modify(find = 'copy' image = #00ff00)
    modify(find = 'paste' image = #0000ff)
    remove(find = '"format"')
}
```

## Notes

* Once an item is validated and a target identified, the process instruction values are applied to the targeted menuitem.
* The `find` property is mandatory and must match the title of the item to be modified.
